so the story on my part is a little funny because i grew up in central square cambridge which is about a
15-minute walk from harvard university but uh growing up and going to high school we always thought of
harvard yard which is the area where a lot of the classes and the students live
in dormitory we thought of harvard yard as just a yard that we walked through to get to harvard square to hang out and
have fun because in high school we just hung out in harvard square a lot yeah but
the short story is that after junior year we have to take the psat back in my days um
and uh after getting your score and you get a certain range the schools will send you a catalog and so uh i received a catalog
that summer and the harvard brochure looked very nice so i started having a different different image yeah of what
harvard yard stood for and um and so that sort of inspired me
to study hard for the test to be able to prepare myself for the application but one of the honest truth
about why uh to pursue these uh prestigious school is that in in america at least these are the
schools that have the most resources and harvard has a very good financial aid
package and so if you're a student who work hard to get yourself to the stage of being able to have good test scores
or a good um resume you are providing an opportunity for yourself to have a chance to get an
education for free and so that is one of i think uh a great incentive for young people um to think
about i think one of the one of the main goals that a lot of the vietnamese students right now when it comes to

be financially stable and i can make the most money and i think on the one hand that is that

inspiring to not shy away from things that are difficult or uncomfortable because they can be growing moments
